(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8581824788/job/23519249070)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8581824788/job/23519249118)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8581824788/job/23519249013)
Is it true that `lcm (Associates.mk a) (Associates.mk b) = Associates.mk (lcm a b)`? If so can you prove it; and if not, are you sure this instance is a good idea?

Which is to say; is the following sorry true?
```lean
theorem Associated.gcd [CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [GCDMonoid α]
    {a₁ a₂ b₁ b₂ : α} (ha : Associated a₁ a₂) (hb : Associated b₁ b₂) :
    Associated (gcd a₁ b₁) (gcd a₂ b₂) :=
  sorry

instance [CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [GCDMonoid α] : GCDMonoid (Associates α) where
  gcd := Quotient.map₂' gcd fun a₁ a₂ (ha : Associated _ _) b₁ b₂ (hb : Associated _ _) => ha.gcd hb
```
It is, pushed :). Please add the lemma I ask for above, which is now true by `rfl`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: GCDMonoid (Associates α) instance
